div.bibl: Vita Nuova, January 1925. CHARITY IN THE ITALIAN COMMUNITY.

body.p: The well-known politician, Joseph Esposito, Committeeman of the 25th Ward, distinguished himself during the Christmas holidays by the charity which he gave to the poor of our community. He made a distribution of money, clothes, food, and coal to the people who were in imperative need. The generosity of Mr. Esposito is worthy of praise.

The Garibaldi Institute directed by the Rev. P. Decarlo, also made a large distribution of clothes, food, and coal to about 300 poor families. This philanthropic institute maintains a school for Italian children, and is located in the center of the thickly populated district of Taylor street where the largest number of Italians live.
